text: Dmitry Vasil'evich Shirkov (; 3 March 1928 â€“ 23 January 2016) was a Russian theoretical physicist. He was known for his works to quantum field theory and to the development of the renormalization group method. He used to work at Lund University in Sweden. He was born in Moscow, Russia. Shirkov died at his home in Dubna, Russia from a heart attack on 23 January 2016 at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Biography at the department of Quantum Theory and High Energy Physics at MSU Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Scientists from Moscow Category:Russian theoretical physicists
